Articles.Content:
Yes, as the title suggests, I need boat builders. But not just anyone but people who can create something that is WORKING, RELIABLE, INNOVATIVE, and LAAAAARGE.

I Have made a boat as an inspiration for future ones, here's the link to it ---> http://www./download/ggvxuubb8iwk5pi/WX-Joseph+T9.craft

The ONLY MOD (and only one) you can use is BD Armory... http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/85209-BDArmory-v0-5-1-Dev-Thread-(small-fixes)-Sept-3

Type of Boats to make:

Trade/Cargo/Freight Ships

Patrol Boats

Landing Craft

Carriers **Priority**

Destroyers

Battleships

Missile Cruisers

Criteria for ANY ship:

-"Works"

-Able to float on water

-Able to traverse on Water

-Does not break apart at full speed

-Somewhat Maneuverable

~You can customize your ship in any way possible as you like~

BUT WAIT!!! Large boats are very hard to maneuver... Worry not for I will give a necessary "Technology" in the craft file above.

:DReason why I'm doing this is because there are not too many ship-tech makers out there, got an idea for a ship? Or even a large ship already? Request or Share away!

SO COME ON PEOPLE HELP ME OUT HERE!!!

Edited September 11, 2014 by IMaKIDfromPH

Boats you say?

How about subs?

I have been thinking about trying to make a submarine.

By the way i can see this being moved to the rocket builders forum

sorry man no subs...currently they are impractical vessels....at 5 m/s for a small sub with no ammo it's kinda doomed for now. but i do have a large welded one that is just siting below the water and can travel at 1.3 m/s! it carries about 11 missiles i think...i'll upload pics soon here

BTW man you should join us at KMC where i build a fleet for some combat-already have a destroyer and a marine carrier for us and im' about 70% done on a massive 120 meters carrier (welded of course) also here are the sub pics-

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Very interesting indeed. We're very limited when it comes to below-surface vessels so no to submarines until the Devs change this in the future

You can feature this in your line up of boats, what i ended up coming up with after seeing this thread, Gave up on a sub.

Download link:

http://www./download/51u2fi4imc271cc/Jet+ATV+mk2.craft

Jet ATV mk2

Driving instructions

Action group 1 toggles the engines, enter the water below 50m/s and then have fun.

To do a spin pitch down and while pitching down pitch to the left or right.

To stop a spin and change direction cut the engines for a second, change direction then re apply them, it will come around much faster if you do this.

No SAS required (Not recommended)

As a side note it will do 100+m/s in the water, but the kraken comes forth and obliterates it.

It is also capable of 160ish m/s on land if you keep it straight. not recommended at all.

Video for more instruction.

This boat is fully functional and maneuverable.

BUT! It barely has any fuel, so you might have to use the infinite fuel thing via the debug menu (f12 or alt+fn+f12 on mac).

http://ge.tt/6yrpCJy1/v/0

Mmm I was going to tell you about the "gentlemans navy" thread but it's now closed

So instead Id like to add my Navy to the list

I do need to re-do most ships as I've learnt heaps since I started with them, but I'm really proud of my AC2 for laythe.

All craft 100% etc etc

I wont flood u with pic's instead just let you know they can be found here;

CC NAVY

-Zip also comes with rockets & missiles as subassembles for any that want to arm Stock boats without mods.

And I wonder what is this all leading 2 ?

Are you planning a future navel battle ?

Perhaps turnbased games of "Battleship"

Oh I cant help but add at least 1 pic

deepwater subs may be possible by using a captured asteroid to keep a ship down.

The armored Corvette, USS Enforcer with only 46 tons of displacement and extremely durable armor. Weapons are not included due to their classified nature, and this ship has not been through all trials yet due to a lack of time.

Download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/7vcvjxqxw10fo6r/UKN%20Perry.craft?dl=0

Bonus: Don't let the North Koreans drive your ships. No ships were hurt in the making of these screenshots.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

It survived quite a few torpedo strikes without even a scratch. I have an APC/Troop carrier under construction, but this ship can go on land, too.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Future naval projects will take priority after the completion of the first fully operational AIM-54 Phoenix and the NCADE missile for boost phase and terminal phase interception along with anti AWAC based roles in combat.

One possible reference design for my future combat vessel.

The AIM-54 could be upgraded into a version of the AGM-65, which is already in limited deployment.

Any potential AGM-65 naval deployments will have to take place on my new ships, but you're all welcome to try to cram my outdated exocet missile on the corvette.

Edited September 22, 2014 by andrew123

deepwater subs may be possible by using a captured asteroid to keep a ship down.

great idea.

but how can you get an asteroid to attach to a ship if the asteroid almost always is sinking to the level where most ships can't swim?
